metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35525 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In SQlite 3.31.1, a potential null pointer derreference was found in the INTERSEC query processing.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm1
sqlite3 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sqlite: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
sqlite3 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-1ubuntu1.5+esm1').
